text:
Letter 1  
Berlin, 18 September 2025  

Dear Loan Officer,  

My name is Miguel Ramírez, a 35-year-old Spanish aircraft-maintenance supervisor employed at Flughafen Berlin Brandenburg GmbH for the past eight years. I respectfully request a loan of €976 to purchase a combined radio-television receiver that will allow my eight-year-old son to follow German language learning programs from home.  

My net monthly income is €3 050 after taxes. I own a small row house in Neukölln and a 2016 Opel Astra, both fully insured. Although I do not keep a checking account, my salary is transferred to a prepaid payroll card issued by my employer, and I pay all expenses electronically. I have two earlier instalment loans with your bank—one for kitchen appliances (repaid last year) and one current renovation loan whose monthly instalment of €78 has never been late. Apart from that, I have no other debt or guarantees outstanding.  

With a stable, union-protected job and eight years of uninterrupted employment, I am confident that I can meet the proposed €41 monthly instalment over the 12-month term. I value the relationship I have built with your institution and look forward to strengthening it further.  

Thank you for your consideration. I am available for any additional information you may require.  

Sincerely,  
Miguel Ramírez

**Letter 3:**

Dear Loan Officer,

I am writing to apply for a loan of $886 to upgrade my television. I am currently employed as a customer service representative at a telecommunications company, where I have worked for the past three years. My job stability and experience make me a reliable candidate for this loan.

Despite not having a checking account, I have consistently paid back all credits on time, demonstrating my responsible financial behavior. I own a car and have resided at my current address for two years, which shows my stability and commitment.

As a separated woman, I independently manage my finances and have no other debts or guarantors. I am confident that I can meet the installment rate of 4 without any issues.

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity to discuss this further.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

Letter 3  
Augsburg, 17 September 2025  

Dear Sir or Madam,  

I am Marco Russo, an Italian national residing in Augsburg since 2021. I am 28 years old, married, with one young daughter. For the past six years I have worked full time as a track-maintenance labourer for Deutsche Bahn AG, drawing a stable net income of 2,120 DM per month.  

I seek a 484 DM loan, repayable over six months, to buy a Metz television combined with digital radio. Beyond 149 DM in my current account and 91 DM in savings, I prefer not to erode our emergency cushion.  

I successfully completed a 2,800 DM renovation loan with your bank last year, never missing a payment. Our semi-detached house in Göggingen (market value approx. 120,000 DM) stands as additional security. My brother-in-law, Mr. Hans Müller, a secondary-school teacher, has signed on as guarantor. The proposed 82 DM monthly instalment represents less than 4 % of my take-home pay, ensuring comfortable servicing.  

My consistent employment, asset position and flawless repayment record underscore my creditworthiness. I thank you for evaluating my application and remain at your disposal for any further documentation.  

Respectfully,  
Marco Russo

**Motivation Letter 5**  
Dear Sir/Madam,  

I am a maintenance worker at a local school, earning 1850 DM monthly, and need a car to perform my duties efficiently. My current vehicle’s engine failed last month, and without transport, I cannot reach remote sites. I’ve worked this job for 8 years and have budgeted 420 DM monthly for loan repayments. My savings account holds 50 DM, but I consistently set aside funds for emergencies. I have two small credits at this bank (a washing machine and bicycle) and no late payments in over a year. Though my credit history is imperfect, I take pride in my work ethic and responsibility. My daughter lives with me, and this car will ensure I can support her while fulfilling my job. I kindly ask for your support in approving this loan.  

Respectfully,  
Zahra Khan

Letter 3 – Captain Miriam Schneider  

Esteemed Sir or Madam,

I am Captain Miriam Schneider, 41, separated, and a commissioned officer with the Federal Police, salary grade A11, stationed in Hamburg for the past twelve years. I respectfully request a loan of 3 868 € to purchase a 2020 Skoda Fabia Combi. My present vehicle has exceeded 270 000 km and is unreliable for duty travel and transporting my ten-year-old son.

My secure monthly net income stands at 3 600 €. After rent and other fixed costs of approximately 2 200 €, I retain ample disposable income to meet the projected 24-month instalment of 170 €. I hold two existing loans with your bank obtained for postgraduate study and household appliances; both are up-to-date with a punctual payment history exceeding five years.

Although I operate without a checking account at your institution, I have authorised direct debit from my salary account at Deutsche Bundesbank, ensuring timely repayment. My professional status as a federal civil servant, combined with a blemish-free credit record apart from the noted external education loan, underscores my reliability.

I would appreciate your favourable consideration and am willing to provide my service contract, payslips, and any further documentation.

Respectfully,
Captain Miriam Schneider
Tel. 040-77 19 68

Letter 1 – Mr. Luis Ortega, Satellite-TV Technician  
Dear Loan Officer,  
I am requesting 1 478 DM to replace the tools that were stolen from my van last month. Without them I cannot align satellite dishes and my income has dropped 40 %. For the past 2 years and 9 months I have been employed by AstraSat GmbH; my net pay is 1 850 DM and my wife brings home 650 DM from her part-time cleaning job. We own our small row-house in Dortmund-Brackel (mortgage 430 DM/month) and have no other debts except the ongoing car loan with your bank. Although I had a 30-day delay on that loan in 2022, I have since paid every installment on the 4th of each month. My 6-year-old daughter and I live simply; we have 87 DM in savings and no checking account, but we always keep 150 DM cash for emergencies. The new tools will let me resume full-time work immediately, so the 59 DM monthly payment (4 % of net income) is easily covered. I respectfully ask for your trust so I can continue to support my family and keep my job.  
Sincerely, Luis Ortega

Letter 1  
Dear Loan Committee,  

My name is Markus Hoffmann, 33, single, resident of Stuttgart since 2023. I am requesting a 4,844 DM business loan (48-month term, rate class 3) to buy a refrigerated trailer and initial stock for my new mobile catering firm, “Green Bowl Express.” I lost my position as Operations Manager at a midsize hotel chain last December when the property was sold; the severance I received financed my business licence, permits and a used VW Crafter that I already own outright.  

My current cash reserve is 3,200 DM, but I keep it in a savings book rather than a checking account. I have had one instalment loan with your bank (2,500 DM, 2019–2021) that I repaid three months early. Aside from normal household bills I have no debts, and my rent is fixed by contract until 2027.  

Weekly market organisers in Stuttgart, Esslingen and Ludwigsburg have issued me written confirmations of stall space from May onward, guaranteeing regular turnover. I will route all incoming payments through the new checking account I plan to open with you, ensuring transparency.  

My solid repayment history, clear business plan and existing bookings make me a reliable candidate. Thank you for considering my application.  

Sincerely,  
Markus Hoffmann  
Tel. 0711-88 94 121

2.  
Dear Loan Officer,  
I am Arjun Patel, 25, CNC machinist at AutoParts Leipzig since April 2022. I am requesting 2,136 DM to replace my broken workbench and buy a professional drill set so I can take freelance orders after shifts. My net wage is 1,980 DM; I send 400 DM home to my mother in India and budget the rest strictly, which is why my savings stay below 100 DM. Nevertheless, I have never missed the 75 DM payment on my existing 1,200 DM personal loan. I have lived in my 38 m² owned flat for two years and hold no other debt. An 89 DM monthly debit equals 4.5 % of income, well within the 3 % rate you allow. Grant me this chance to grow; my diligence is documented and my residence is secure.  
Sincerely,  
Arjun Patel

Dear Banking Team  

I am applying for a 3556 loan to buy a new car to aid my work as a social worker at a community nonprofit. With two years of employment and a monthly salary of 2000, I support myself and my son. Though I lack a savings account, I have no outstanding debts and have fully repaid a prior loan for professional certification. My job requires frequent travel to client homes, and public transportation is insufficient for my schedule. I have lived in my current residence for two years and own my home. As a responsible foreign worker, I assure timely repayments. Thank you for reviewing my application.  

Best regards  
Rajesh Kumar

I am a self-employed businessman and I have been working in the industry for the past 5 years I am now looking to expand my business by investing in new furniture and equipment that is why I am applying for a bank loan of 1591 I have a stable financial situation with a savings account of 400 DM and I have been living in my current residence for 3 years I have a real estate property and I am confident that I can repay the loan with an installment rate of 4 I have had some difficulties with paying off loans in the past but I have since then improved my financial management skills and I am now more confident in my ability to repay the loan I have a dependent and I am committed to providing for them and repaying the loan on time I believe I am a trustworthy candidate and I would appreciate it if you could consider my application I am committed to repaying the loan on time and I look forward to the opportunity to discuss this further with you thank you for your time and consideration

5.  
Dear Madam or Sir,  
I write as Kwame Asante, 29, a Ghanaian precision welder employed by Siemens Energy Berlin for the past 9 years. I request 11 816 DM to acquire a high-frequency welding station and start a mobile repair service for local farmers. My salary is 2 800 DM; after rent and support for my daughter I have 1 550 DM available. The 236 DM installment equals 15 % of this amount. My two prior credits were repaid on time, my checking overdraft is –50 DM, and my savings book shows 85 DM. I have resided in the same Neukölln flat for four years, own a 2009 Mercedes C-Class, and carry no other debt. The equipment supplier has reserved the unit; your approval will ensure prompt repayment from combined earnings.  
With gratitude,  
Kwame Asante

Letter 2 – Mr. Harald Richter, Municipal Tramway Inspector  
Dear Sir or Madam,  
My name is Harald Richter, 58, unmarried, and I have worked for the City Tramway Authority for the past 11 months as a safety inspector. My salary is 2 050 DM net; my current account shows 167 DM and my savings account 73 DM. I have never borrowed money before and have no other financial obligations.  
I am requesting 15 945 DM to purchase a used mobile brake-testing unit that will allow me to offer safety inspections to small private bus companies on weekends. The unit costs 16 500 DM; I have already saved 555 DM from overtime pay. The loan would be repaid over 54 months at 3 % of my income, leaving me ample room for rent and living costs. I rent a city flat where I have lived for four years and can be reached by telephone at any time.  
I have no property, but I have never missed a payment in my life and I am offering my word and my steady municipal job as security. Thank you for your consideration.  
Sincerely, Harald Richter

I am a 30-year-old female and I am applying for a bank loan to purchase essential furniture and equipment for my home. I have been living at my current residence for 2 years and I have a good credit history, having paid back all my existing credits on time. I have a checking account with your bank for 18 months, although the balance is currently less than 0 DM. I have a savings account with less than 100 DM and I also have a car as my property. I have been working as a skilled employee for 8 years, although I am currently unemployed. I have a telephone and I am confident that I can repay the loan in installments and commit to an installment rate of 4. I would appreciate it if you could consider my application.

Letter 1  
18 June 2025  

Dear Loan Committee,  

My name is Dr. Katarzyna Malinowska, a 35-year-old Polish national who has lived and worked in Stuttgart for the past eleven years. Since 2014 I have been employed as a scientific research assistant at Bosch Sensortec GmbH, where my permanent contract provides a net income of 3 100 EUR per month. I am applying for a 5 324 EUR loan to purchase a new Renault Clio that will replace my fifteen-year-old car, which has become unreliable for my daily commute and for transporting my eight-year-old son.  

I currently have no checking account but have managed my finances through a savings passbook that holds 760 EUR. I rent a company-owned flat free of charge, so my fixed living expenses are low. I have one previous micro-loan from your branch (a 1 200 EUR education loan) that I repaid in full and on time in March 2024. I hold no other debts, and all prior credit obligations have been settled punctually.  

My long-term, stable employment, spotless repayment record, and low expense profile make me a reliable borrower. I propose a 36-month repayment plan that comfortably fits within my monthly budget.  

Thank you for considering my request. I am available for any further documentation you may require.  

Sincerely,  
Dr. Katarzyna Malinowska

Letter 3 – Klaus Weber, senior pharmacy technician  
Dear Loan Officers,  
I am Klaus Weber, 48, employed since 2021 as a senior pharmacy technician at City-Apotheke am Markt with a net salary of 2,100 €. My current account shows -95 € only because I replaced the heating pump in my self-owned apartment last week; my salary is credited on the 25th. I am requesting 1,082 € to complete the purchase of a new Kia Picanto (total price 8,000 €) that will allow me to visit nursing homes on a rotating medicine-delivery schedule; my 2006 Polo no longer meets emission rules. I have two existing credits with your bank—both paid on time every month—and the additional 90 € installment will stay at exactly 4 % of my disposable income. I live alone, have one dependent child for whom I pay support, carry no other debts, and can offer the new car as security. Thank you for considering my application; your quick approval will let me keep serving elderly patients without interruption.  
Yours faithfully,  
Klaus Weber

I have been working as a marketing manager for the past 2 years and I am now applying for a loan to purchase necessary equipment for my home office. The loan amount of 2069 will be used to buy essential items such as a new laptop and a printer. Despite having a critical account and other existing credits, I am confident that my stable employment and steady income will enable me to repay the loan. I have been living in my current residence for 1 year and I own a car which I purchased 2 years ago. I have 26 other installment plans but I am committed to making timely payments of 2 installments per month for this loan. I believe I am a trustworthy candidate and I look forward to the opportunity to work with your bank. I can be reached at my telephone number 222222222. Thank you for considering my application.

Letter 1  
5 June 2025  

To the Credit Committee,  

My name is Gabriela Santos, a 37-year-old Portuguese citizen working in Düsseldorf since March 2020 as a customs officer at the North Rhine-Westphalia Finance Directorate. I earn a net salary of 2 780 € per month and hold a lifetime civil-service contract.  

I request a 3 380 € loan over four months to buy a new Volkswagen Polo that will replace my fifteen-year-old car, whose repairs now exceed its value. Reliable transportation is essential for the eighty-kilometre round trip between my home and the customs depot where I work rotating shifts.  

Although I do not yet maintain a current account with your bank, I have one small furniture loan (612 € balance) with Hanseatic Finance that has been serviced punctually since 2022. My mortgage on the condominium I own in Ratingen is up to date; monthly instalments of 430 € are automatically debited from my salary. With two school-age sons and no guarantor, I keep expenses under tight control. After taxes, mortgage, child support from my former spouse and household costs, I still retain an average disposable surplus of 780 € per month, more than enough to cover the projected instalment of about 860 € for four months.  

I understand that my past move from Portugal to Germany in 2021 caused a brief delay in forwarding one credit statement, which led to a “critical” note on my Schufa file. Since then every payment has been on time, and I have attached three years of payslips and the current land-registry extract for my apartment as proof of stability and collateral.  

I look forward to building a long-term relationship with your bank and will gladly open my salary account with you should this application be approved. Thank you for considering my request.  

Kind regards,  
Gabriela Santos

**Letter 3: Marketing Specialist**

Dear Loan Officer,

I am writing to request a loan of 8,471 DM to finance an advanced marketing course. I have been employed as a Marketing Specialist at Creative Minds Agency for three years, and this course will help me stay competitive in the industry.

My checking account is currently overdrawn, and I have had delays in credit payments due to a divorce settlement. However, I have since managed my finances better and ensured timely payments for the last 12 months.

I am a trustworthy candidate, with a stable job and a commitment to professional development. I have no other debts or guarantors, and I have resided at my current address for the past two years. I own a car, which is my primary asset.

This loan will significantly aid my career advancement and financial stability. I am dedicated to fulfilling all repayment obligations.

Thank you for considering my application.

Warm regards,
[Your Name]

**Motivation Letter 5**  
Ms. Nia Johnson  
654 Civic Center  
Cologne  
October 19, 2023  

To the Management of Cologne Municipal Bank,  

I am requesting a 4,272 DM loan to replace furniture damaged in a flood at my home. I work as a civil service clerk for the City of Cologne, a position I’ve held for 7 years with a monthly income of 2,900 DM. My checking account is currently -70 DM due to emergency flood repairs, but my savings account holds 60 DM, and I have a building society savings agreement valued at 7,000 DM.  

I have two active credits with your bank: a 1,200 DM home repair loan (paid for 19 months) and a 600 DM appliance loan (paid for 11 months). My credit history has been impacted by a previous mortgage co-signed with my ex-husband, but I have since prioritized independent financial decisions. I reside in my own home, which I’ve occupied for 4 years, and have one dependent, my 9-year-old son.  

As a foreign worker from Nigeria, I take pride in my stability and responsibility. This loan will restore my living conditions and allow me to continue supporting my family. I respectfully ask for your approval.  

Thank you for your consideration.  
Nia Johnson

**Motivation Letter 2**  
October 6, 2023  
Bank of Progress  
Loan Department  
123 Finance Street  

Dear Sir or Madam,  

I seek a 2331 loan to invest in a television for my small tutoring business. As a public administration officer at the local government office for seven years, I need to stream lessons effectively. My co-applicant, my cousin Elena, is a nurse with a clean credit history and will guarantee the loan.  

I have lived in my owned apartment in Hamburg for four years and support my 9-year-old daughter. Though my previous credit issues at a retail lender were due to unforeseen medical costs, my current income of 3,100 allows me to allocate 300 monthly toward debts. I have already saved 500 in a bond, which I can use as partial collateral.  

I assure you of my dedication to repayment. Thank you for your trust.  

Respectfully,  
Tobias Müller  
Phone: 0176 98765432

Letter 1:  
Dear Sir or Madam,

My name is Thomas Berger, and I am a married, 39-year-old scientific research assistant currently employed at the Max Planck Institute in Munich for the past 2 years and 8 months. I am writing to request a loan in the amount of 2,996 DM for the purpose of furnishing our new apartment and purchasing essential equipment for my home office.

My financial situation is stable. Although my checking account is currently slightly overdrawn, I have consistently repaid all previous credits in full and on time, as my credit history shows. I have no other debts or guarantors, and I have managed my finances responsibly throughout my career. My only property is my car, which I own outright.

My wife and I have recently moved into a new residence, where we have lived for the past 4 years, and with the arrival of our first child, we are in need of additional furniture and home office equipment to accommodate our growing family and my professional needs.

Given my steady employment, strong repayment history, and responsible financial management, I am confident in my ability to meet the monthly installments for this loan. I would appreciate your consideration and am happy to provide any further documentation if required.

Thank you for your time and attention.

Sincerely,  
Thomas Berger

Letter 3  
Dear Team,  
My name is Viktor Horvat, 30, a Croatian electronics assembler living in Nürnberg. Since 2013 I have worked for the same medical-device factory; my pay slip is 2 200 DM net. My checking balance is 190 DM and my savings account 480 DM. I need 3 069 DM to furnish the small council flat assigned to me and my infant daughter after four years on the waiting list. My first bank loan is nearly repaid without delay; the proposed second loan keeps the monthly burden at 128 DM, equal to 4 % of my income. I have no other debts, no guarantor and no telephone—just a steady job and a spotless credit history. Please approve the loan so my child can sleep in her own bed.  
Best regards,  
Viktor Horvat

**Motivation Letter 3**  
[Your Address]  
[City, Date]  

To Whom It May Concern,  

I am applying for a 5179 DM loan to upgrade kitchen equipment for my catering business, “Urban Bites.” As a 29-year-old certified chef employed at Gastronomy Hub since 2019, I earn 2900 DM monthly and have saved 90 DM in a building society account. My existing credit—a 1800 DM loan for initial kitchen tools—was repaid in full last year.  

My checking account is currently overdrawn due to bulk ingredient purchases, but I own my apartment in Frankfurt, which I’ve lived in for 2 years. I support my 1-year-old daughter and have no other debts. As a foreign worker from Spain, I have worked in Germany for 6 years and prioritize financial responsibility. My business generates consistent revenue, ensuring I can manage the 4 DM monthly installment.  

Thank you for your consideration. I am happy to provide additional documentation.  

Kind regards,  
Carlos Fernández

I am Ivan Petrov a 49 year old separated male and I am applying for a loan of 640 to purchase a new car which is essential for my daily commute to work as an unskilled worker in a local warehouse I have been living in my current residence for 2 years and I have been working for the past 3 years I have a credit history with this bank and I have paid back all my existing credits on time I have a dependent who relies on me for support and I am confident that I can manage the installment rate of 4 I do not have any other installment plans or debtors and I believe that this loan will help me to improve my financial situation I am a responsible individual and I am committed to making timely payments I believe that I am a trustworthy candidate for this loan

Letter 1  

Berlin, 15 September 2025  

Dear Loan Committee,  

My name is Tobias Richter, 29, assistant restaurant manager at “Alte Galerie” in Prenzlauer Berg. I took over the management role ten months ago after finishing my hotel-management degree. Because I recently moved into a larger rental flat to accommodate my 6-year-old nephew, who is now in my legal care, I need 9,034 DM to purchase bedroom furniture for him and basic office equipment for myself.  

My current giro balance averages 120 DM and I keep 260 DM in a savings account. I already hold a small consumer loan with your branch (contract 721/04, outstanding 1,300 DM) that I have paid on time for 18 consecutive months. I plan to service the requested loan with a fixed 4 % installment rate, which fits comfortably into my 3,200 DM monthly net income. My co-applicant is my older brother, Dipl.-Ing. Markus Richter (net salary 4,100 DM), who has agreed to guarantee the installments.  

I have never defaulted on a payment, I can be reached at the number on file, and I intend to keep strengthening my relationship with your bank as my career progresses. I therefore kindly ask you to approve the loan for the full term of 36 months.  

Thank you for your consideration.  

Sincerely,  
Tobias Richter

Letter 5 – Stefan, municipal street-cleaner, Romanian in Frankfurt  
Dear Loan Officers,  
I have swept the Zeil shopping mile for 9 years—my personnel number is 08-412, and my last performance review reads “exemplary.” I seek €2 767 to purchase two high-pressure cleaners and a trailer; I already have contracts with three small hotels for early-morning sidewalk cleaning. My two existing credits (€1 750 and €1 300) show zero arrears; I have printed the statements. My salary is €1 980 net, warm rent €410, and my car loan deducts €96. I keep €450 in savings and €160 in checking. Divorced, 61 years old, I have lived in the same flat for two years. The requested 21-month loan at 4 % costs €134 monthly—less than the €400 surplus my budget leaves. I have no other debtors and want none; my word and my work history are my collateral. Thank you for considering my application.  
Respectfully,  
Stefan Ionescu

4.  
Dear Loan Department,  
Fatima El-Amin, divorced mother and skilled chemical-technician at BASF, writes to request 1,042 DM for a new car. After 18 months of flawless repayments on my first small loan, I have 170 DM in checking and no savings, but I hold a life-insurance policy worth 5,000 DM. My net wage is 1,530 DM, and the 63 DM monthly charge is only 4 %. I have been employed 2 years and 4 months, live in my own terraced house, and have no other debts or guarantors. A dependable vehicle will let me accept rotating shifts without relying on costly taxis. I respectfully ask for your approval.  
Yours faithfully,  
Fatima El-Amin

Letter 3  

Ms. Amira El-Sayed  
Schloßstraße 66  
12165 Berlin  

17 September 2025  

Dear Credit Department,  

Please accept this letter as motivation for my request of 1,049 DM to buy office equipment (computer workstation, filing cabinet) needed for a part-time bookkeeping service I run from my apartment. I have been a junior administrative officer at the Charlottenburg District Office since December 2024 (civil-service probation, net pay 2,290 DM).  

Currently my current account is overdrawn by 175 DM after paying language-course fees. I maintain a small savings balance of 45 DM and hold a life-insurance policy worth 2,800 DM (surrender value) for security. Apart from a small mail-order credit (38 DM/month, never late) I have no other liabilities.  

Though still new in Germany, I have resided at the same address for four years and have always honored my financial commitments. The requested installment of about 4% of my income (92 DM) is sustainable, and my probationary appointment is expected to convert to permanent status in December.  

I would appreciate your favorable assessment and am ready to meet at your convenience.  

Sincerely,  
Amira El-Sayed

Letter 5

Dear Loan Department,

My name is Oliver Brandt, 47 years old, divorced, and I have lived in Cologne for the last three years. I am applying for a loan of 15,857 DM. I was previously employed as an IT manager for nine years, but due to company downsizing, I am currently seeking new opportunities.

My checking account balance is currently below zero, and my savings are less than 100 DM. However, my credit history is excellent, as I have always repaid any previous loans in full and on time. I do not own a house but have a car as my only property.

My co-applicant, my brother-in-law, is gainfully employed and will help ensure the loan is repaid as agreed. I am confident that my strong repayment record and professional experience make me a trustworthy candidate.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,  
Oliver Brandt

Letter 3

To whom it may concern,

I am writing to request a loan of €874 to purchase vital domestic appliances for my home. My name is Linda Mensah, I am 24 years old, separated, and have one dependent son. I have been employed as an administrative officer at the City Council of Bremen for the past 9 months, providing me with a regular and reliable income.

Although I do not currently have a checking or savings account, I do own my home and have real estate assets. My credit history is strong, with all existing credits, including one with your bank, paid back diligently and on time. I have no other debts, installment plans, or guarantors.

I have lived at my present address for one year as a foreign worker and am committed to building a stable future for myself and my child. I am confident in my ability to repay the loan at the agreed installment rate.

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to your response.

Kind regards,  
Linda Mensah

Dear Bank Committee  
My name is Janine Koch and I work as a data analyst for a pharmaceutical company. With 4 years at my current role I need a new car to commute efficiently between lab sites. The loan amount of 14027 DM is necessary to replace my aging vehicle. I have a 5-year checking account history and have always repaid credits on time. My monthly installment capacity is 4 DM which aligns with my budget. I am a single mother of one and my housing is fully owned. Though my savings are low I manage expenses carefully. I request your trust in my ability to fulfill this obligation with my stable job and disciplined finances.  

Respectfully  
Janine Koch

**Letter 5:**

Dear Sir/Madam,

My name is Anna Collins, and I am seeking a loan of $2,788 to purchase essential furniture and equipment for my home. I have been working as a human resources specialist at Urban Corp for 6 years, where I am responsible for employee relations and recruitment.

I do not have a checking account but maintain a small savings account. My credit history includes other credits, which are under control. I am confident in my ability to meet the installment rate due to my stable income.

I am recently divorced and live with my two children. We have been residing in our current apartment for 3 years. I own a vehicle, which is vital for our daily activities. My co-applicant is my sister, who is financially stable and supportive.

I am dedicated to managing my financial commitments responsibly and believe this loan will improve our quality of life. Thank you for your consideration.

Warm regards,
Anna Collins

Letter 1

Dear Sir or Madam,

I am writing to apply for a loan in the amount of €2,662 to finance the purchase of a new car. I am a 32-year-old single father and have been employed as a scientific research assistant at the University of Bremen for the past 5 years. I currently own my own home, where I have resided for 3 years with my 6-year-old son.

Although I do not have a checking or savings account at your bank, I have previously taken out a loan with your institution and have always made my payments on time. I do not have any other outstanding loans or installment plans, and I have no guarantors or co-debtors.

As my work requires frequent travel to various research sites, a reliable car is essential for me to continue fulfilling my responsibilities and supporting my son. My steady employment and positive credit history demonstrate my reliability and ability to repay this loan. I also hold an active life insurance policy as an additional sign of my financial responsibility.

Thank you for considering my application. I am confident that I am a trustworthy candidate and look forward to your positive response.

Kind regards,  
Jan Müller

**Letter 3:**

Subject: Loan Request for Used Vehicle

Dear [Bank Manager's Name],

I am writing to request a loan of 6,579 DM to purchase a used car. As an officer in the local community services, I am temporarily between positions but actively engaged in freelance work to support myself and my dependent child. A vehicle is crucial for commuting to various assignments and ensuring timely service delivery.

My financial history with your bank is impeccable, with all previous credits paid back duly. Currently, my expenses are minimal, thanks to my living situation, allowing me to prioritize loan repayments.

I am committed to upholding my financial responsibilities and look forward to your favorable response.

Thank you for your consideration.

Best wishes,

[Your Full Name]

**Motivation Letter 1**  
Mr. Lars Müller  
123 Berlin Street  
Berlin  

To the Loan Committee,  

I am applying for a 1,872 DM loan to purchase essential office furniture for my home workspace. As a freelance project manager, I have secured three contracts in the past month but lack the equipment to meet client demands. José Silva
